content.description:
Just as good as it's twin but with a longer traverse and more air under your feet.

Stand-start on the slanting edges and move up left into the finger crack.  Climb the crack with good locks (crux) to the good rest at the "Intersection" at 18 feet.  Traverse right for 12 feet on good holds in the secure rail and exit around the arete.
content.protection: As many pads and spotters as you want, though the climbing is very secure up high.
content.location: Upper Canyon, left side (south rim), northeast face of the T-Crack Boulder.  Couple hundred yards or so past the Top Gun Area.  The boulder is obvious and the crack faces the main trail.

content.description:
A unique and mellow high line for the high-baller.

Stand-start on slanting edges down and right of the crack and make a move up left to gain the crack.  Climb the crack with great finger-locks (crux) to the rest at the "Intersection" at 18 feet.  Traverse left in the crack and move straight up on good holds when the crack ends.  Take care topping out.
content.protection: As many pads and spotters as you want, though the climbing is very secure up high.
content.location: Upper Canyon, left side (south rim), northeast face of the T-Crack Boulder.  Couple hundred yards or so past the Top Gun Area.  The T-shaped crack faces the main trail.
